Responds quietly and negatively to Evelyn’s knock and greeting, showing reluctance or unfriendliness in interaction.

Successfully drags his numb arm out from under himself and lifts his head despite a hangover, showing some physical resilience and effort.
Has evidence of a late night partying (ink smudge, club stamp) and is suffering a severe hangover, indicating poor self-management and potentially compromised functionality.
In his room, surrounded by artistic objects like cameras and photos, suggesting he engages in skillful or thoughtful activities, hinting at intellectual or creative competence.
Plea to God to 'never do this to me again' after hangover, implying a recognition of own limits but also a repeated pattern of behavior leading to negative consequences.

Allows Evelyn to remove his pillow despite groaning and discomfort, showing tolerance and passive acceptance.
